column12: Select the public engagement of science domain that fits your opportunity best.

column2: Designed with after-school groups in mind, the Meet a Scientist series is hosted by the Scientist in Every Florida School and partners like The Boys and Girls Club of Martin County and Prime Time Palm Beach County. Sessions are highly informative 30-minute peeks inside of some of the most fascinating fields and careers in science today. Geared for K-8 learners, yet open to all ages, this series lets the students ask inquisitive questions of the scientist. Learn about Florida’s springs, home to the greatest number of first magnitude springs in the world.
column3: UF's Scientist in Every Florida School

column1: Colorful Climates: Teaching Climate Change through Art
column2:
This professional development workshop presents a transformative approach to teaching complex climate science concepts through the lens of art. This immersive session aims to empower STEM teachers with new tools to communicate the nuances of climate change effectively, making this global crisis more tangible and comprehensible for students.

The first half of the day delves into the foundations of climate change teaching, focusing on a local perspective to make the topic more relatable, exploring the unique habitats of Florida, highlighting their characteristics and the specific climate change challenges they face. The afternoon portion engages educators in a species study, correlating the effects of climate change with local biodiversity. The workshop proceeds to highlight the interconnectedness of life and the environment, emphasizing the far-reaching impacts of climate change on ecosystems.

column1: Unleashing Potential: Sparking Creativity and Cultivating a Growth Mindset (LEVEL 3)
column2:
This workshop explores the potential of a growth mindset in the classroom setting, sparking creativity and igniting a lifelong love for learning in students. The workshop begins by exploring the fundamental principles of a growth mindset, a concept that emphasizes the potential of every individual to learn, evolve, and overcome challenges. Participants will learn practical strategies to cultivate this mindset among their students, encouraging them to see difficulties as opportunities for growth rather than barriers to success as it delves into the power of creativity in the educational setting. 

Throughout the workshop, teachers will participate in interactive activities designed to strengthen their understanding and application of these principles. This includes group discussions, problem-solving tasks, and collaborative planning sessions to develop growth mindset-oriented lesson plans. This workshop not only encourages educators to nurture these principles in their students but also embraces these values in their teaching approach.

column1: Soaring Through Science: Unraveling the Physics of Flight in Aeronautics
column2: This workshop is carefully designed to empower teachers with the knowledge and hands-on experience needed to bring the principles of flight and the physics behind it to life in their classrooms. Teachers will reflect on the day's activities, solidifying their understanding and brainstorming ways to incorporate these aeronautical lessons into their classrooms. This unique professional development opportunity combines theoretical understanding with hands-on application all while empowering educators to bring the wonder of flight into their classrooms, sparking curiosity, and deepening student understanding of aeronautical physics.

column1: STEM Talent Search: Discovering and Nurturing Tomorrow's Innovators
column2:
This professional development workshop will delve into the exciting process of identifying and fostering the abilities of the STEM stars of tomorrow, with a particular focus on underrepresented student populations who are too often overlooked and mis-identified. Educators will learn strategies for identifying and nurturing STEM talent in these student populations, gaining an understanding of the myriad ways STEM aptitude may present itself. A crucial part of this process will be recognizing the importance of culturally responsive teaching practices in encouraging STEM talent.

The participants will be introduced to strategies for creating culturally-responsive STEM curricula, along with understanding the role of cultural competence in nurturing STEM talent. The workshop wraps up with a review of key concepts, strategies learned, and resources for continued learning and support. This immersive and enriching workshop will also feature an esteemed guest expert panel. Participants will be encouraged to leverage this expertise to create an action plan for implementing these strategies in their classrooms, setting the stage for the next generation of STEM innovators.

column2:
This workshop, aligned with our mission to empower educators and embrace neurodiversity, emphasized the strengths of neurodiverse individuals in STEM fields and provided practical strategies for creating inclusive learning environments. Through dynamic discussions and interactive sessions, participants will gain insights into leveraging these strengths for academic success and implementing innovative teaching practices. 

The collaboration between the Stiles-Nicholson STEM Teacher Academy and PPT4ed demonstrates a commitment to making a difference in education, equipping participants with tools to promote inclusivity and diversity in classrooms, locally and nationwide.

column1: Exploring Authentic Conservation Education: Teachers as Ambassadors for Change
column2:
Join Stiles-Nicholson STEM Teacher Academy and Inwater Research Group on this place-based field experience, the nearshore waters off the coast become a classroom with instruction being led by those conducting the research, generating authenticity. Teachers become active participants in conservation, and more importantly, ambassadors for change, which they then bring back to their schools.

Teachers will spend the morning on a chartered boat at one of our local, active study sites. They will watch us bring threatened and endangered species aboard our vessel and collect data, as they ask questions and learn about the various species. Educators will be able to see how our trunk programs mirror the research we conduct, down to the scientific tools and anatomically correct sea turtle model. During the workshop portion, we will unpack our trunk programs and showcase lessons from each, walking teachers through the programs. They will get hands-on in the same capacity as their students as they learn about the trunk contents, standards, and connections for their students.

column1: Everyday Science & Nature Journaling: Nurturing Literacy Skills in Science Students
column2:
Join us for an exciting Professional Development experience where you'll explore the beautiful Grassy Waters Nature Area by canoe or on foot, gathering valuable data and immersing yourself in science journaling. Be sure to come prepared with suitable outdoor clothing to fully engage in nature observation activities.

This workshop is designed to introduce educators to two innovative types of student journaling: everyday science journals and surprise journals, along with the classic nature journals. Interactive sessions, discussions, and practical exercises will enrich your understanding and application of journaling techniques, equipping you with strategies to nurture literacy skills, curiosity, and critical thinking in your students.

column1: Code Defenders: Unlocking the World of Cybersecurity and Programming in the Classroom
column2:
This teacher workshop is designed to facilitate an enlightening journey into the critical field of cybersecurity and programming, particularly curated for the middle school level. This engaging and innovative session aims to equip educators with the tools needed to introduce students to essential cybersecurity concepts and programming principles, thereby nurturing their interest and honing their skills in these crucial 21st-century competencies. 

Teachers are immersed into the fundamentals of cybersecurity—confidentiality, integrity, and availability. A focus on the essentials of binary coding and circuits follows, utilizing an 'unplugged' approach to fully comprehend these key concepts. Further exploration into the art and science of securing information through cryptography is undertaken, along with discussions on authentication and privacy. The workshop then transitions into the practical realm of programming, where participants learn about algorithms, networks, inputs, outputs, operators, variables, and loops. An interactive session using Ozobots demonstrates the real-world applications of programming. 

The aim of this workshop is to empower teachers to confidently expose their students to the world of cybersecurity and programming, thus fostering an informed, skilled, and responsible generation of digital citizens.

column1: Florida GeoGebra Conference 2025 Integrating free mathematical software GeoGebra into STEM Education: A Mathematics Perspective
column2:
Join us for an interactive workshop designed for STEM educators seeking to engage students in active learning and enhance their teaching of mathematics through the innovative use of GeoGebra. GeoGebra is a dynamic mathematics software that integrates geometry, algebra, spreadsheets, graphing, statistics, and calculus. 

In this workshop, we will explore how to leverage GeoGebra to create engaging and effective learning experiences in your STEM classroom. Participants will get a hands-on introduction to GeoGebra, its features, and its applications in mathematics education. Including, learning how to create dynamic math simulations, interactive activities, and 3D visualizations using GeoGebra to foster a deeper understanding of mathematical concepts.

column1: Brainwaves 2025: Igniting Innovation with Brain-Based Learning & Action Research Symposium
column2:
This is an immersive professional development opportunity that bridges neuroscience and education, empowering educators to enhance student success through evidence-based practices. Participants will explore the intricate connections between brain anatomy, cognition, and learning processes, drawing on cutting-edge imaging studies and scientific research to inform their teaching methods and lesson designs. The seminar delves into how cognitive development evolves with age, social maturation, emotional growth, and cognitive progression, providing teachers with a comprehensive understanding of the factors influencing student learning. 

A key component of the day is the introduction to action research as a powerful reflective tool for educators. Participants will learn how to implement this approach to continuously refine their teaching practices, creating more impactful and enriching learning environments for their students. The workshop emphasizes practical applications, including the use of movement, visuals, music, and props to appeal to multiple intelligences and enhance learning.

Beginning in 2025, this event will culminate in a Research Symposium where teachers will have the opportunity to share their action research projects. This symposium will also include an introduction to: LabCraft: Designing Florida Academic Standards for Science-Aligned Science Labs for Grades K-5
column9: FAU Stiles-Nicholson Brain Institute, 5353 Parkside Dr, Jupiter, FL 33458

column1: STEM/STEAM Lab Success: From Startup to Stellar
column2:
Making the leap to STEM/STEAM specialist can be both thrilling and daunting. There's no one-size-fits-all approach, and you might feel like you're starting fresh. This educator workshop is designed to support you, whether you're new to the role or a seasoned pro.

We'll dive deep into the practicalities of running a stellar elementary STEM/STEAM Lab. From creating an effective learning space to managing shared resources and crafting an engaging curriculum, this workshop covers it all. You'll walk away with a toolbox full of ideas to transform your own STEM/STEAM Lab!
column9: A.D. Henderson University School,, 777 Glades Rd, Boca Raton, FL 33431
